content.title: Vascular Behçet Disease
content.description: Arterial and venous manifestations of Behçet disease

key_concepts.details: Vascular involvement in 7-38% of Behçet patients; more common in males
DVT most common manifestation; cerebral venous sinus thrombosis, IVC thrombosis
Pulmonary artery aneurysms characteristic (pathognomonic); aortic and peripheral aneurysms
High anastomotic pseudoaneurysm rate; optimize immunosuppression before surgery

content.clinical_significance: Pulmonary artery aneurysm is life-threatening and unique to Behçet disease
